item.source: Bank command from being used in wildy

item.title: Bank command from being used in wildy
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Make sure the command is in “Commands.java”. Right under any other command, like the command “players”. Put it under that command, and make it this:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“bank”)) {
if (c.inWild())
return;
c.getPA().openUpBank();
}

Make sure it’s not anywhere else in the Commands class.

Read full topic

item.title: Bank command from being used in wildy
item.dc:creator: @triger545 triger545
item.description:
@triger545 wrote:

Here. This may work. It worked in my server.

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“bank”)) {
if (!c.inWild())
c.getPA().openUpBank();
}

@i_stake_i wrote:

This is my bank command. ::bank. and it’s able to be used in wild which isnt cool. so will someone help me on getting it where that will not happen in wild.

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“bank”)) {
c.getPA().openUpBank();
}
